FuncDef:
The cpu-defend-policy batch command applies an attack defense policy.
The undo cpu-defend-policy batch command cancels the application of an attack defense policy. The cpu-defend-policy batch command applies an attack defense policy. The undo cpu-defend-policy batch command cancels the application of an attack defense policy. By default, the default attack defense policy is applied to the device.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of the attack defense policy.
The attack defense policy must already exist.

Indicates the start slot ID to which the attack defense policy is applied.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 31.

Indicates the end slot ID to which the attack defense policy is applied.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 31.

ExtraInfo: An attack defense policy takes effect only after it is applied to a device. Only one attack defense policy can be applied to a board.
